data.title: Former Revco / CVS
data.meta_description:
I wonder if this was originally a SupeRx drugstore since it is right next to an old Kroger store. A couple other SupeRx stores I know of went SuperRx > Revco > CVS. This store is listed as being a Revco then a CVS before CVS built a new store outside of the shopping center in 2002.
	
	The Hocking Mall was built in 1977. It was originally anchored by a Kroger grocery store and a Murphy's Mart discount store. This shopping center was never enclosed so it makes me wonder if an enclosed mall was originally planned here. Many shopping centers with the word "Mall" in the name were originally designed as enclosed malls then had plans altered into a normal shopping center.
	
	In the late 1980s, the Murphy's Mart store chain was acquired by and re-branded as Ames. The store lasted through the early 1990s Ames closure waves that hit Ohio particularly hard. In fact, the Ames store lasted all the way until an August 2001 closure wave.
	
	Kroger built a new store adjacent to the shopping center in 1995 leaving their old store empty. Sears Hometown and Peebles later moved into the old Kroger space. Goodwill and Tractor Supply Company took over the old Murphy's Mart / Ames store. The Hocking Mall underwent a renovation in 2015.
	
	SOURCES:
	>realestate.co.hocking.oh.us
	>Google Earth
	>Ames Fan Club
	>http://web.archive.org/web/20011101185728/http://www.corporate-ir.net/ireye/ir_site.zhtml?ticker=AMESQ&script=410&layout=7&item_id=200889
	
	If you want to use this photo please contact me (Nicholas Eckhart) in one of the following ways:
	>Send a FlickrMail message
	>Comment on this photo
	>Send an email to eckhartnicholas@yahoo.com
data.text:
I wonder if this was originally a SupeRx drugstore since it is right next to an old Kroger store. A couple other SupeRx stores I know of went SuperRx > Revco > CVS. This store is listed as being a Revco then a CVS before CVS built a new store outside of the shopping center in 2002.

The Hocking Mall was built in 1977. It was originally anchored by a Kroger grocery store and a Murphy's Mart discount store. This shopping center was never enclosed so it makes me wonder if an enclosed mall was originally planned here. Many shopping centers with the word "Mall" in the name were originally designed as enclosed malls then had plans altered into a normal shopping center.

In the late 1980s, the Murphy's Mart store chain was acquired by and re-branded as Ames. The store lasted through the early 1990s Ames closure waves that hit Ohio particularly hard. In fact, the Ames store lasted all the way until an August 2001 closure wave.

Kroger built a new store adjacent to the shopping center in 1995 leaving their old store empty. Sears Hometown and Peebles later moved into the old Kroger space. Goodwill and Tractor Supply Company took over the old Murphy's Mart / Ames store. The Hocking Mall underwent a renovation in 2015.
